chunk_metadata.created_by: Enhanced Markdown Chunker with Comprehensive Context

works.Name: Fantaisie op. 72,2
works.Availability: Performance score (P/s) and hire materials (h.m.) via Furore Verlag
works.Notes: Orchestrated by Yves Henry in 2014 from 1927 septet manuscript; premiered by Madame Henri Deblauwe
works.Long Description: Four-movement work merging Modéré – Scherzo – Très lent – Final vif; shows influence of César Franck and Fauré while retaining Bonis’s own voice.
works.Short Description: Romantic piano-orchestra fantasy in four continuous movements.

works.Name: Byzantine Concerto
works.Availability: Performance score (P/s) and hire materials (h.m.) via Furore Verlag
works.Notes: Inspired by Byzantine-Serbian liturgical chants; piano treated as orchestral instrument
works.Long Description: Three-movement concerto (Preludio quasi una Toccata – Aria – Finale) based on second, third and fourth Byzantine modes; homage to Serbian cultural roots.
works.Short Description: Piano concerto rooted in Byzantine liturgical traditions.

works.Name: Concerto No. 2
works.Availability: Performance score (P/s) and hire materials (h.m.) via Furore Verlag
works.Notes: Very pianistic writing within contemporary yet accessible idiom
works.Long Description: Three-movement piano concerto (Allegro moderato – Adagio tranquillo e semplice – Allegro molto) blending traditional concerto form with contemporary language.
works.Short Description: Pianistic three-movement concerto in contemporary idiom.

works.Name: Music for Horn & Chamber Orchestra
works.Availability: Performance score (P/s) and hire materials (h.m.) via Furore Verlag
works.Notes: Romantic-lyrical pastoral piece; idiomatic writing for horn with bitonality
works.Long Description: Six-movement work (Dolce e tranquillo – Allegro moderato – Moderato – Andante moderato – Senza misura – Andante molto tranquillo) evoking Alpine glow; peaceful with dramatic contrasts.
works.Short Description: Pastoral horn concerto in six short movements.

works.Name: Music for Tuba and Orchestra
works.Availability: Performance score (P/s) and hire materials (h.m.) via Furore Verlag
works.Notes: Originally for children’s concert with narrator; story of a bear learning to sing
works.Scoring: Tb solo, 2.2.2.2.-4.2.2.0., Hrf, Klav, Timp, Str
works.Long Description: Concerto highlighting the tuba as soloist; programmatic children’s piece with narrator about a bear who wants to learn to sing.

works.Name: Ceilidh
works.Availability: Performance score (P/s) and hire materials (h.m.) via Furore Verlag
works.Notes: Gaelic title means 'informal gathering for dancing, singing and telling stories'; uses Scottish dance forms and church modes
works.Long Description: Guitar concerto in six Scottish dance movements (Air – Reel – Jig – Strathspey à la Sarabande – Hornpipe – Slip Jig) with archaic modal flavour and playful transitions.
works.Short Description: Scottish-dance guitar concerto evoking ceilidh atmosphere.

chunk_info.processing_notes: All six works provide full title, composer, instrumentation, duration, publisher and catalogue data; one work (Music for two Saxophones and Orchestra) lacks sufficient detail and was omitted.
